intro: Zaleya pentandra, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and often have a slightly hairy texture. Zaleya pentandra typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
